paragraphs.text: Free community college isn't a joke for families who spend half their income to send a child.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: In the United States today, the odds of getting a degree are more tightly linked to family income than ever before, thanks to skyrocketing college costs and insufficient and misallocated federal and state financial aid funds
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Although the federal government distributes about $170bn a year in financial aid to many types of students attending many types of schools
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: many low-income families still have to pay too much
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Low-income families often end up paying about 40% of their family income for a member to attend community college
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: for four-year colleges, the bill can add up to a whopping 59% of a family's earnings
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Even middle-class families may be asked to spend or borrow a quarter of their annual income to finance one child's attendance at a public university
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: while the costs of a private one are yet higher
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As a result, many families of modest means are unable to afford college
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Students from middle- and low-income families have also become more likely to drop out from public colleges and universities, leaving with debts they can't afford to pay back rather than degrees
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But these are more than just personal tragedies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they represent a significant loss to America's economy and competitiveness for decades to come
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On Friday, President Obama offered a simple, universal solution: free tuition for two years at community colleges for students who maintain a 2.5 grade point average, attend at least half-time and make steady progress towards completing their program
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The federal government would cover three-quarters of the average cost of community college
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: participating states would be expected to pick up the rest
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The last time a president did something this bold on higher education was the original Higher Education Act of 1965
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Then, President Lyndon Johnson had a huge Democratic majority in Congress to support his proposal
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: President Obama, on the other hand, faces a tougher road in a government run by Republicans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who are reluctant to support spending more money to help poor and middle class people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: yet they should forego partisanship and take this legislation seriously
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Instead of being available only to the poorest students(like Pell grants) free community college tuition would be available for all
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The most powerful and enduring American social policies - Social Security, infrastructure investments like the highway system and indeed public education itself- have always benefitted everyone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it stands now
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: America's outdated student aid policies simply aren't fulfilling their mission and are instead actively failing to make college affordable for all students
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And, unlike many other proposals to fix the twin problems of college affordability and student debt focused on four-year programs, free community college has the potential to meet the immediate needs of employers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who often say that they cannot find potential candidates with needed skills
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Community college programs in fields like nursing, technology and even management are designed to give students the skills that employers need more quickly than the average bachelor's degree program
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Obama's plan is far from perfect
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is not a catch-all solution
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: other major problems in American higher education still need to be addressed- including for-profit colleges that consume vast amounts of federal aid dollars but often leave students with little more than terrible debt burdens
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The costs of private and public four-year institutions should not be ignored
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so that the number of bachelor degree graduates will again rise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And the President's proposal only gives students a discount on tuition
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which is just one part (albeit a major one) of the cost of going to school
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Yet there is no question that Congress should, if anything, seek to outdo Obama with an even more ambitious proposal, rather than negotiate to reduce his package
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They should not let this proposal die upon arrival
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Families can't afford to wait through more years of inaction
paragraphs.label: assumption
